intro: Ricoila verna, commonly known as the spring crocus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Iridaceae family and typically blooms in early spring. The plant features showy, cup-shaped flowers that are usually blue or purple in color. Ricoila verna grows from corms and prefers well-drained, sandy or gravelly soils. It is often found in open woodlands, meadows, and along stream banks.
